		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_attachment_custom_header_last_used_creativeily]]></wp:meta_key>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_attachment_is_custom_header]]></wp:meta_key>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Sample Page]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?page_id=2</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 27 Nov 2022 20:03:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?page_id=2</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:quote -->
<blockquote class="wp-block-quote"><!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></blockquote>
<!-- /wp:quote -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>...or something like this:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:quote -->
<blockquote class="wp-block-quote"><!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></blockquote>
<!-- /wp:quote -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>As a new WordPress user, you should go to <a href="http://www.lifebydictionary.com/wp-admin/">your dashboard</a> to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-11-27 21:23:36]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-11-27 21:23:36]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[sample-page]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[draft]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Privacy Policy]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?page_id=3</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 27 Nov 2022 20:03:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?page_id=3</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:heading --><h2>Who we are</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>Our website address is: http://www.lifebydictionary.com.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Comments</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor&#8217;s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Media</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Cookies</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select &quot;Remember Me&quot;, your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Embedded content from other websites</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Who we share your data with</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>How long we retain your data</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>What rights you have over your data</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Where your data is sent</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[about]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/about/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 09 Jan 2020 13:06:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?page_id=135</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:image {"id":924,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/photo_2021-12-17_04-44-42-768x1024.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-924"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:separator {"opacity":"css"} -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-css-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Kenneth Clark</strong> writes  poetry and micro-fiction. He grew up outside of New Orleans, and has resided in southeast Asia and most of the southeastern United States.  His work has appeared in <em>Greatest Uncommon Denominator</em>, <em>Fried Chicken and Coffee</em>, <em>Poor Mojo’s Almanac(k),Night Train</em>, and elsewhere. He is author of <em>The Collected Histories of Water</em> and more recently <em>Eggs of American Songbirds</em>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Life by Dictionary (this site)</strong> is hosted on an OpenBSD server somewhere I rarely visit these days.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-11-27 21:07:38]]></wp:post_date>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[The Demons of Miracle Court]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/the-demons-of-miracle-court/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 11 Jul 2022 10:23:14 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=958</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Let us go to happiness—away from the YOU or the I of everyday argument.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":1006,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/photo_2022-07-11_05-16-43-768x1024.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-1006"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The dream remains: <em>ad astra!</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Nothing Nowhere Never]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/nothing-nowhere-never/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 05 Jun 2022 11:53:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=962</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:image {"id":963,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none","hasCustomCSS":true} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/photo_2022-06-05_06-51-33-768x1024.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-963"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"className":"animated bounceIn"} -->
<p class="animated bounceIn"><s>Stop with the excuses. Unplug from the dervish of (INSERT CURRENT PROBLEM). Get your act together, man-child. Do not give in.</s></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Fuck that noise. COMPLAIN. WFH sucks. People who trample over you suck. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>EVERYTHING SUCKS.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>There are replicants wasting away in cold storage, spun by Io's orbit that have more interesting lives.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Scromit Express]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/scromit-express/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 03 Jul 2022 16:24:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=990</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:image {"id":988,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/F54706F0-5B82-41E7-9E86-7C953ACE8F18-768x1024.jpeg" alt="" class="wp-image-988"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><li>No music</li><li>No books</li><li>No photography</li><li>No art</li><li>No philosophy</li><li>No daydream</li><li>No nightmare</li><li>No exercise</li><li>No skateboarding</li><li>No conversation</li><li>No intimacy</li><li>No foolishness</li><li>No stargazing</li></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>ONLY a boot-heel on the throat,  a kick in the back.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I am concerned about myself.  Escape no longer provides relief or enjoyment.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":986,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/20D26391-4123-4193-B3EF-5D9CF51C1FA6-768x1024.jpeg" alt="" class="wp-image-986"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>992</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-07-03 19:36:32]]></wp:post_date_gmt>

		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="dream-journal"><![CDATA[Dream Journal]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="photographs"><![CDATA[Photographs]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="recovery"><![CDATA[Recovery]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[lbd notes 7/12/22]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/lbd-notes-7-12-22/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 12 Jul 2022 10:34:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1010</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Here we go. Instead of combing through old posts or journals to transcribe into here, I am going to just add some dream notes, random thoughts, but try and stay focused on WHAT this book would be about. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>What's the idea? I want to abandon the gimmick for now. The title means nothing to me.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Research hagstones, bulletproofing a car, the anole's lifespan and factoids about them. I had one in my dream last night that had babies, and the babies clung onto their mama lizard. (Anole even a lizard by taxonomy?)</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong> </strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>So it is JUST a working title and does not need to be a crucial part. LET the gimmick, gimmick.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I want to write about my poor decisions: how living a life of spontaneity has left me unfulfilled. MIND you that I am not unfulfilled now, but I was up until a short time ago. LET this be a fun ride, but a cautionary tale.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I want to use flash-forward and -back.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1010</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-07-12 10:34:28]]></wp:post_date>

		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-07-12 10:34:28]]></wp:post_modified>

		<wp:status><![CDATA[private]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>

		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>

										<category domain="category" nicename="dream-journal"><![CDATA[Dream Journal]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="novel"><![CDATA[Life by Dictionary, a novel]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Transit (working title for October 9 poem)]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1015</link>
		<pubDate></pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1015</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>(rough guidance: look through phone for 0ctober 9th in the past (since you've been in New Orleans)</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>ABOVE not reliable. I was posting pictures on October 9 of our trips that we took on other dates</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Look up other factoids about 10/9 and 10/9/72 specifically</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Freewrite about what defines her</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>she would find you across Times Square at a terrible crossroads of your life, and without choosing for you, help you along your path. She does good things because they matter to her universe, without virtue signals or the comeuppance of social media.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Let the title appear during or after composition</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>do not re-describe any cliche of location or emotion: FIND the moments between the ACTIONS and examine that.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>STRUCTURE: 3  / 4 / 5  repeat (six stanzas total)</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>two revelations: one regarding R and one myself.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:verse -->
<pre class="wp-block-verse">v.1
When summer rains slow we wander a bit—
let the child in us have a few moments
between the sun-bright deluge &amp; humidity

Your reflection in the puddle isn't you, still
there's a pause—the same I wake up and stare
to just take all that you are, in. A persistent
feather of hope. The last good one. A beginning

that 

v.2
Transit

When summer rains relax we wander a bit— 
let the child in us have a few moments 
between a sun-bright deluge and humidity 

Your reflection in the puddle isn't you, 

EXPAND ON S2L1

still
 there's a pause—the ??? same ??? I wake to stare 
and just take all that you are, in. A persistent 
feather of hope. The last good one. A beginning 

that

###</pre>
<!-- /wp:verse -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1015</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-08-27 05:57:08]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[0000-00-00 00:00:00]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-08-27 05:57:08]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[0000-00-00 00:00:00]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[draft]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[pillow talk at high noon]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/pillow-talk-at-high-noon/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 27 Jul 2022 02:15:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1045</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Somewhere not-coast Florida well after midnight. We stopped for gas and beer, and paid in loose change. Some of the coins still sticky from the center console's swamp of cigarette ash, water, beer, and food bits. A man could live off of car leftovers if he was inclined or forced to.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The insects swarmed the streetlights and under the pump's canopy. Thick like you swatted them away to cut a path. On point. The little monsters filled the empty space I'd create like a swarm of fish. So many bugs. You give up and eat some. The Circle of Life is drawn on an Etch-a-Sketch. The Secret of Life is drawn on an Etch-a-Sketch.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>He said his name was Stevie with two ee's. Stevee. We shrugged him off and we walk through a field of high weeds to the convenience store. Stevee walks off behind the building.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>C-store nachos &amp; cheese are only bested by nachos at a ballgame. We are loaded up with Mountain Dew, chips, that shitty popcorn with the cheese covering that gets under your fingernails. Stevee is just outside the door swinging a possum by the tail. He's swaying it back and forth, and to his left and right. His smile is infectious.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"I'm gonna clear this whole parking lot of these mole crickets."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We were confident they were not mole crickets, but their songs belted out from those ears they have on their legs. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Eat them all, Mr. Possum!" Stevee hollered.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Now he looped the possum over his head, and made figure eights. The possum screeched and clawed at the air. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"See? He's reaching for 'em!"</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The middle-aged clerk came outside with a broom and threatened to call the cops.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Ain't no cops around here and nobody care nothing about a possum or Stevee!" he said as he slowed the possum down to a short circle in front of him.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The clerk was having none of the parking lot shenanigans. She shooed off two underage girls in bikinis drinking wine coolers, and she pulled out her phone.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Give me that goddamn possum!" she told Stevee. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I opened a can of beer and took a caffeine powder. "Ma'am, I think that boy isn't right."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Oh we know. He's always here doing dumb shit. Last week he set up turntables and tried to throw a rave."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Music is my life!" Stevie shouted with the possum now on the ground but still in his firm possession.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Then the possum gained an angle and bit the hell out of Stevee. "I'll be right back," he said.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Then we pumped gas, four dollars in change at a time. We moved the beat-to-shit Chevy to the airpump, and there came Stevee back this time with two possums a-swinging.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Fuck these mole crickets!" He sang out.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Privacy Policy]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?page_id=1229</link>
		<pubDate></pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?page_id=1229</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:heading --><h2>Who we are</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>Our website address is: http://www.lifebydictionary.com.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Comments</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor&#8217;s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Media</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Cookies</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select &quot;Remember Me&quot;, your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Embedded content from other websites</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Who we share your data with</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>How long we retain your data</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>What rights you have over your data</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Where your data is sent</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p><strong class="privacy-policy-tutorial">Suggested text: </strong>Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_attachment_metadata]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:6:{s:5:"width";i:1170;s:6:"height";i:1170;s:4:"file";s:37:"2023/07/photo_2023-07-21_05-16-48.jpg";s:8:"filesize";i:158641;s:5:"sizes";a:6:{s:6:"medium";a:5:{s:4:"file";s:37:"photo_2023-07-21_05-16-48-300x300.jpg";s:5:"width";i:300;s:6:"height";i:300;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";s:8:"filesize";i:18218;}s:5:"large";a:5:{s:4:"file";s:39:"photo_2023-07-21_05-16-48-1024x1024.jpg";s:5:"width";i:1024;s:6:"height";i:1024;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";s:8:"filesize";i:126266;}s:9:"thumbnail";a:5:{s:4:"file";s:37:"photo_2023-07-21_05-16-48-150x150.jpg";s:5:"width";i:150;s:6:"height";i:150;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";s:8:"filesize";i:5504;}s:12:"medium_large";a:5:{s:4:"file";s:37:"photo_2023-07-21_05-16-48-768x768.jpg";s:5:"width";i:768;s:6:"height";i:768;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";s:8:"filesize";i:82367;}s:35:"creativeily-featured-image-blogfeed";a:5:{s:4:"file";s:38:"photo_2023-07-21_05-16-48-1024x400.jpg";s:5:"width";i:1024;s:6:"height";i:400;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";s:8:"filesize";i:73933;}s:28:"creativeily-thumbnail-avatar";a:5:{s:4:"file";s:37:"photo_2023-07-21_05-16-48-100x100.jpg";s:5:"width";i:100;s:6:"height";i:100;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";s:8:"filesize";i:3022;}}s:10:"image_meta";a:12:{s:8:"aperture";s:1:"0";s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:0:"";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";s:1:"0";s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";s:1:"0";s:3:"iso";s:1:"0";s:13:"shutter_speed";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:11:"orientation";s:1:"0";s:8:"keywords";a:0:{}}}]]></wp:meta_value>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[I did not survive]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/i-did-not-survive/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 07 Jan 2020 15:05:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=132</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Living in the French Quarter. I am dead and walking in the fog between simulations only governed by a stuck clock. The distance between tic or toc. End breath wasted, wasted.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[This does not exist]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/this-does-not-exist/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 15 Jan 2020 20:33:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=155</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>And neither do I.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>or happiness opened up and swallowed all of us (me)--</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[do not answer, do not reply]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/do-not-answer-do-not-reply/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 07 Mar 2020 12:47:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=164</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Share no opinion and have no opinion. Find friendship and gratification in dreamworld where you came from and soon return. The corporal world was never real to begin with. You knew this when you were a child, and when you cry or cum.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":165,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/photo_2020-03-07_06-41-47.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-165"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>164</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-03-07 12:47:11]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-03-07 12:47:11]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2020-03-07 12:47:11]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2020-03-07 12:47:11]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[do-not-answer-do-not-reply]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="other"><![CDATA[Other]]></category>
						</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Forgetting (during) the Pandemic]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/things-we-forgot-during-the-pandemic/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 Apr 2020 12:50:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=168</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/1/2020 - Body-wide muscle soreness arrived today. I walk a couple miles a day at the most, and haven't been skating or exercising. Not clear why the exhaustion. . .</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/2/2020 - Aches were ghost symptoms. Nothing today except the regular crack, strain, and throb of a skateboarder's body halfway to one hundred years old. The relief is palpable although those around me won't notice a change in my surliness or sadness. Some clocks tick slower.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/3/2020 - No fever. Took time to reconnect with the people and person(s) that I needed/wanted to. The death numbers rise. The anxiety and fear climbs. The days are sunny and mild, teasing us from our retreat inside. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/11/2020 - Time was never real and we knew that even though everyone pretended it mattered. My mother has been moved to hospice care, and because of the COVID-19 global pandemic I will not be able to see her again. Parkinson's and other ailments have taken her mobility, her voice. The mind and humor still sparks behind her eyes (the last time I saw her, April 2019). I owe, I owed, I will owe her better.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/12/2020 - Memory was never reliable. I don't trust the NOW.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/13/2020 - I am afraid.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/14/2020 - And today delivered fever and a raspy cough. This is exhaustion and not malaise. I do not remember smiling. Worn down from sinus attacks and seesawing between chills and (being) overly warm.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/14/2020 (end of day) - Just fear in my gut. Anxiety causing physical ills. My Mother is at The End. I will never be ready for these next days.<br></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/15/2020 - Dread. I spoke today with calm, reposed. She heard me over my brother's speaker. "It's okay, it is okay."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/16/2020 - I am now in the last half of this life. Goodbye, mother.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/20/2020 - Her body has been cremated.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/21/2020 - This slow-motion apocalypse--and what bad timing for a cry that will not come. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/21/2020 - 15:54 CST - Despair.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/22/2020 - The place where wind goes when all is still. You were never here to begin with. We keep each day empty until eventide when everything vanished reverses course. The river is high again this year.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/23/2020 - Plenty of work and a year where many have nothing. Kept me busy enough to not feel the cloak of depression. Ah, there you are, old friend.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/24/2020 - The New Orleans Saints Super Bowl win really was one of the most fulfilling and exciting days of this life. Wish I would have shared it with my mother. The rest of days are just useless. . . </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/25/2020 - Almost a full day passed and felt normal. The slightest gesture or phrasing, song or interaction just removes any armor that I've created. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/26/2020 - Everyone is fine. It's the Pandemic. It's their problems. It's what they can't go do. The world is about how you interact with it, not it with you. Nobody cares any longer. The loneliness may get worse and the crippling guilt may gather at the border, but nobody rides at daybreak to save you. Get used to it. You've known this all along anyhow.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/27/2020 - I hear friends complain about missing their lifestyle in overly emotional pleas across social media. They miss being noticed, and validated. It makes sense. The void lets no prisoner escape. The final singularity where you have gone. I miss you. Perhaps we meet on the sidewalk in a city at the edge of daybreak, when it is the coldest and the birds shake their wings. Perhaps I make the same mistake and don't notice who you are, and really were.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/28/2020 - Each single morning a Sisyphean task. The afternoon a half-nap. I can't leave this place. I don't want to. I thought I would feel different when these days came. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/29/2020 - Time wasted in vain is solely on me. I will not visit these demons on others, or attempt to hold accountable for what was my sole failure(s). And I can not let that happen again. Time back home has cut its hurting blade with every bit of fun I've had. The give &amp; take. I won't let this happen again.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4/30/2020 - "How are you feeling (this morning, today, during all of this)?"</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><em>My mother died two weeks ago. That's how I am doing.</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Goodbye April. Let there be lilacs.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>168</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-04-02 12:50:16]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2020-04-02 12:50:16]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2020-04-02 12:50:16]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2020-04-02 12:50:16]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[things-we-forgot-during-the-pandemic]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="other"><![CDATA[Other]]></category>
						</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[The Sabertooth Eats Its Own Leg]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/the-sabertooth-eats-its-own-leg/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 13 Apr 2020 22:31:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=181</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:verse -->
<pre class="wp-block-verse">One day
lizards learned
to fly and escaped
the tar pits and entrapment
where their lives were
mired in muddy asphalts
disguised as oases,&nbsp;or
convenience and safety
in the fauna.
These new birds drifted
on warming currents above
their brethren,&nbsp;peering
down at the young who
die beautiful,&nbsp;who are left
for the ugly toothed cats
at sediment’s edge.
Predators with an uglier
future of prejudice and pride
proud enough to become
stuck inside the trap
that caught the prey,
ignorant to the point
of wiggling down deeper
instead of up and
out,&nbsp;or away.</pre>
<!-- /wp:verse -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":253,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/photo_2020-04-13_17-28-32.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-253"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>181</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2020-04-13 22:31:20]]></wp:post_date>

		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>

										<category domain="category" nicename="poetry"><![CDATA[Poetry]]></category>
						</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Through the popweeds, lemongrass]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/through-the-popweeds-lemongrass/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 02 May 2020 10:54:54 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=219</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>5/1/2020 - By large (and many small) miracles I am alive. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>5/2/2020 - I miss the dead but not the living.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>5/3/2020 - First day in weeks that I've not privately sobbed.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>5/4/2020 - Another not-miserable start today. Here's to holding on to hope.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>5/5/2020 - Down bad</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Leaving this series as-is. No dailies rolled under one post. Tomorrow is Mothers Day and reminiscing is deleterious to my well-being. I will drag the dread behind me by its dark chains for the rest of these days. No escape, no attempt. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>How may I ever be intimate with others if my most accomplished and polished trait is lying to myself? All of us just lack-lust love zombies caught on spindles of this slow motion apocalypse. . .</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":227,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/photo_2020-05-05_09-29-08.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-227"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

						</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[i3status-rust battery issue on Lenovo lappy]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/i3status-rust-battery-issue-on-lenovo-lappy/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 02 May 2020 12:24:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=223</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This works for i3status-rust on my Lenovo Yoga:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> [[block]] block = "battery" </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>device = "BAT1" </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>interval = 60 </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>format = "{percentage}% {time}" </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>(saved for later when I forget this again)</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

		<title><![CDATA[coffee & treacle to sell]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/coffee-treacle-to-sell/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 10 May 2020 11:59:38 +0000</pubDate>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:image {"id":251,"sizeSlug":"large"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/photo_2020-05-10_06-47-10-768x1024.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-251"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:verse -->
<pre class="wp-block-verse">Speak to yourself in the tongue
of theophylline and theobromine,
remember that in fifteen minutes
the free radicals will depart
your vessel, the toxic bile
exiting post-haste.</pre>
<!-- /wp:verse -->]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Alt+SysRq+k]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/altsysrqk/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 21 Dec 2022 03:15:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1048</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You either gave up and caught the last street car or you kept drinking until the metal and wood pachyderms ran in the morning. Another day. One more kiss by the river.You either gave up and caught the last street car or you kept drinking until the wood and metal pachyderms ran in the morning. Another day. One more kiss by the river.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Anonymous one-night stand pooped in the hot-tub. That was her thing. If the hook-up couldn't deal with it, she would move on to another night and city. This was Kansas City, Missouri and the night before an old friend back home told him that Z, his wife, had been cheating on him with her first love. The guy she never shut about. His friend from the subdivision when Y's parents still lived together. Y didn't flinch but he did scoot over around to the other side of her and waited for her to initiate. She used a left-behind pint glass to scoop the shit out of the water. Tossed the glass into a trashcan. Kobe!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>She went all in. Took her hands and grabbed him by the shoulders, and they kissed. Her hands slid down to his ass, and she massaged to the rhythm of the Muzak. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Stand," she demanded. <s>Then in view of anybody who might pass by she pulled his swim trunks down and swallowed all of him with her nose to his stomach.</s> You let the blood do its magick. <s>She backed off a bit, and started throating his bird. (find less Penthouse Letters language for ANY sex.) Pillow lips.</s></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We chose not to catch the last street car. Hell, we walked home many times. Only about two miles. We had made it back to an empty and wet Canal Street. We debated walking back into the Quarter. A small convertible pulled up to us. The driver revved  her engine.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Got any rolling papers?" Her lip curled into a smile. "Seriously--let's keep the party going."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We could not talk. It was too much to take in. Finally R said "Nah, sorry. We turning in."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>And off she sped. Ready to smoke and fuck. Someone else would write the rest of that tale.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><!-- wp:list-item -->
<li>Roofied</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item -->
<li>Threesome</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item -->
<li>Swinging</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item -->
<li>NYC subway mishap w/R &amp; Kim</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item -->
<li>Philippines orgy</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item -->
<li>Shim Sham hook-up w/Pam (FIND BETTER MATERIAL THAN JUST SEX)</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item --></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>TREND TOWARD REPLACING ANY SEX SCENES, SCENARIOS</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><!-- wp:list-item -->
<li>Daytona </li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item -->
<li>OKC</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item -->
<li>Upstate NY</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item -->
<li>NO FUCKING SKATEBOARD B/S</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item -->
<li>Stop doing this for now and write a poem for Roblynn</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item --></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->]]></content:encoded>

		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[I know a way to make the dreams go away]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/i-know-a-way-to-make-the-dreams-go-away/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 07 Oct 2022 17:59:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1142</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Hi. I am a shepherd of adults and children. I make sure these worlds operate in a fashion of their choosing. No, not magick. I mean the dull chores and logistics of material support. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><em>I drink tap water from the bathroom sink.</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I clean, wash laundry &amp; dishes; I feed &amp; water the animals. I walk the ones that require such, and ignore the cats.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><em>Ignoring these cats are one of my few Earthly pleasures.</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><em>I need a hobby, and need to be social.</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Every day, for years. The same routine. Each season that passes I lose a facet off my designed cut. Self-chipped and self-guided. No laboratory-grown gems inside this heart of hearts. But each season something falls away.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"dropCap":true} -->
<p class="has-drop-cap">There is no medicine. There is nothing but another morning where the dreams dissipate, and all of the dust and grime reappear. It is the cycle of submission. The boring out of whatever fanciful thoughts and ideas made their way into my conscious mind during my youth. BE GONE, DRAGONS!</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><em>Be gone dragon, dinosaur, and robot! </em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1142</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-10-07 17:59:43]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-10-07 17:59:43]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-11-29 03:34:27]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-11-29 03:34:27]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[i-know-a-way-to-make-the-dreams-go-away]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[private]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="dream-journal"><![CDATA[Dream Journal]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="the-ending"><![CDATA[The Ending]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1202]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Dream Notes 10/13-14/22]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/dream-notes-10-13-14-22/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 15 Oct 2022 01:18:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1144</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Near-near future: aliens have arrived but only few realize. They've coerced/controlled just enough of population to sway opinion that 1) they aren't even here, and 2) that war with ANYONE else is necessary.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>They have a method of realizing and manifesting a person's nightmare, individual by individual.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>When they do arrive their shock troops are seen as Chinese by those who hate the Chinese, Russian by the same, et cetera.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Mass communication has ended. No worldwide television broadcasts. Word of mouth and return to mimeograph physical copy machinery. Morse code in some instances where wire-to-wire still exists and hasn't been scavenged for 1/100th of pennies on the dollar.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Only coins are used as money. The govt. absorbed all of the paper money and made it obsolete as they went to a digital currency before the attacks began. People have $ cash, but nobody takes. ONLY coinage is trusted now.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The folks who are aware of the aliens are those who have taken Psilocybin, and a person's awareness depends on their listening to the messages they receive from the mushroom trips. The micro-dose crew are hyper-aware of it all, but seen as whackos by the general populace.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I am able to fly because I willed it so during a psilocybin trip, but only became able to fly AFTER the aliens were known to me. Others have unlocked similar, new skills, with a similar timeline. We think whatever system/method/magick the aliens use to enslave/control the regulars (the regs) has also unlocked our new powers. It isn't superhero like, but is above normal.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>My flights are limited, and directly related to eating. I eat voraciously, but you'd not know it from my #2 pencil-thin frame. If I gorge on a filling meal (candy is no help, beer is useless) I get 15-30 minutes of good flying. When my strength wanes I am up and down just above the ground: a pitiful flying stick of bone and long hair.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The nightmares they induce are more selective by pulling certain elements of one's dreams and making them real. You won't be haunted by a full dream, but a bit of it. Perhaps heads on stakes in a public place where they should not be. They deploy the meat-hooks from Hellraiser franchise. I have to pull one from my front, left shoulder and the other from my right hip. The chains retract when free, and clang against each other as they pulled away out of sight.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It is insidious and causes anxiety and fear. Everyone self-medicates. The world has already ended and we are caught in the molasses of a slow-motion apocalypse.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Time-shift or restart of dream: A 747 jumbojet makes a landing in a clearing adjacent to the (college, military, civilian workforce?) dorms. Curiosity leads people to its resting spot, but the aircraft is now blocked by a tall, metallic fence that has appeared along its perimeter. We all know the fence is mysteriously new. Nobody remembers its construction.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I tell my group of friends I'm going to fly up to the roof some five stories high, but must eat first. They offer junk food, and I express I need better sustenance to fly. They humor me and a redheaded young woman wearing a pink beret brings me a roast beef poboy cut into quarters. She eats 1/2 as I do. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Her stare seems off. I wonder if she's been coerced by the aliens. She shows me a cute little mushroom tattoo on the underside of her right forearm--a piece of flash art and nothing unique. I have the same tattoo in the exact same place. I show her and we laugh while finishing off the last quarters of the poboy.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We are on the lawn adjacent to one of the several dorms. Reclined on a patchwork comforter, and watching the clouds. People are discussing in furtive whispers on how to get a good view over the wall. The forest line blocks the aircraft, its large tail the only visible sign it even landed. Government grey with no markings.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Speculation begins: some think the French have attacked, some the Mexicans, and others a conglomerate of African countries. Nobody suspects the United States, or aliens.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"See that cloud there straight up from the water tower?" She nudges me for attention. "That is an opossum who is searching for a mate."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I reply in the negative that I do not see a possum. "A small rodent perhaps. A gerbil?"</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"No, no it's a possum. Was in my dream the other night. That's how I know," she says assuredly.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"If you say so, I won't argue." We sit in silence a few minutes longer. "Hey what's your name? I'm KEN."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Ugh no, no. I hate my name. Any question but that!"</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Okay no worries, but I dunno how a name could be that bad considering all of the craziness that's happened world-wide lately."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>She pursed her lips in contemplation. "You're absolutely right. It's just a name." She touched my tattoo with thin fingers, and paused with her mouth slightly open. "Mary. Boring ass Mary."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I smiled at Mary. An uncomplicated name for an overly complicated weekend. "It's perfect. . .Now watch this--"</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I stood up, crouched slightly down, and thrust myself ten feet in the air, hovering. Gasps and a few claps from the immediate handful of people. I floated down, and told them I'd go to the rooftop of the last dorm that fronted the treeline, and up I went.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Flying wasn't some superhero action movie skill for me. I didn't gain much altitude, and regularly had to relaunch. To go long distances I needed many landings and takeoffs. Each flight a bit more steady than its prior. After a few hops from dorm to dorm I reached the Hayworth Residential Housing Facility. Each building named after a woman of fame or success. I took a scout's position on the non-facing slope, and peered above the ridge.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The aircraft was gone. There must have been nearly fifty squadrons of troops in formation. I could not determine their origin. All wore dark gray uniforms with no cover, which I found odd. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Suddenly the airplane reappeared, phasing into sight the way a hologram comes and goes. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A cloaking device I whispered only to myself. I jumped off the five story dorm and regained flight right before impact. They won't believe any of this. I decided I'd tell my friends, and for selfish reasons, Mary, first before flying over to the campus police substation.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"It's there, but it isn't. You can't see it unless it de-cloaks. From what I saw, it had to do so to let a group of soldiers re-enter the rear of the aircraft."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Soldiers?!" One of the younger college boys asked. "What the fuck!"</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>They didn't believe the plane could carry 1000 soldiers, and jokingly quipped I must be hallucinating to believe that an entire aircraft could hide itself. They implored me to fly closer and determine where they came from.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Mary agreed with them. "Please, Ken? We are really worried now." She touched my shoulders in the familiar way of long-acquainted friends or lovers.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"I'll need more food, I replied, and she grabbed my hand leading me into the dorm.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> The room's walls were bare save a single dry erase board covered in gibberish. She and her roommate shared a small common area and bathroom with two other sub-rooms. None of the other ladies were around. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"I'm going to make you some oatmeal, and cut some fruit up for it also. And a PB&amp;J on wheat for even extra energy." She said with her head buried in a mini-fridge. "What type of jelly? Oops scratch that we only have orange marmalade."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A grape jelly man myself, I didn't offer up any complaint. Food was energy and this wasn't the time to be picky. I watched her prepare the meal, and I took in her exuberant beauty. Always the redheads, right? </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We stayed in the common room, and sat on the floor with our backs against a tattered couch. She would turn her head slightly away when smiling. It was too late. Mary had my full attention.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A light knock on her door and it opened. The entire eight-plus group from earlier poured into the room. They wanted answers, soon.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I had no desire to get closer to the troops and risk detection. I figured I could get to a taller tree about half-way between the clearing and the dorm for a better view.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"I'm guessing none of y'all have binoculars."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>No replies. A bottle-blonde lady handed me a point &amp; shoot 35mm camera. "The zoom on this may work."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We travel this life with what we have, and not what we dream of.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Here, take this," Mary said softly in a room full of several conversations. Gently she grabbed my wrist and attached a used concert wristband, securing it with some pink duct tape. "Good luck," and there in the company of all of her friends she kissed me for what seemed like several minutes.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I'm jump-flying, coasting, drifting roof to roof again with an immutable smile. I knew I would kiss her today the moment she began to speak. The confident softness of her tone that withheld judgment and invited opinion.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Paused behind the last dorm's ridge, I eyeball my next move. Landing in trees is difficult, and even more a struggle to push off to the next landing. The tree gives, the branches are unsteady or sometimes crack and send me off-balance to the hardpack ground. I'm going to move slowly and stay between the trunks with the hope of doing so stealthily.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>From the ridge I view half the troops as before. They could have reloaded, or spread out. They may be closing in on the campus. No sound of heavy machinery, or forest noise of clumsy enlistees cutting and stomping their way through vines and undergrowth.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Wait, they no longer are outfitted in dark grey. Their uniforms now a camouflage of traditional green and tan swatches. I slide over the roof ridge, and push headlong between the branches, hoping for a successful landing in the Y of a sturdy tree.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Success. Hugging the cottonwood branches, get my bearings and survey the forest. Perhaps two more jumps and I'll get a good look at the troops still at parade rest.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>[begin description of nightmare elements entering reality; loss of ability to fly, the Hellraiser hooks]</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1144</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-10-15 01:18:06]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-10-15 01:18:06]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-10-15 01:18:06]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-10-15 01:18:06]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[dream-notes-10-13-14-22]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[private]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="dream-journal"><![CDATA[Dream Journal]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Future Forward]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/future-forward/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 17 Oct 2022 02:08:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1155</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>They asked why I use a pencil and paper for day math. I half-flash a poor smile. The best defense is pretending. You start this as soon as you grasp a sense of self, and unfortunately, others.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Relationships are founded on the <em>what if</em> and the <em>but wait</em>. You'll learn to listen better. You'll allow space for your lover to be upset in the same way you complain.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The only constant in this universe is you.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I prefer a soft pencil because it gives. A young man in the late 1990's was forced to write right-handed in most rural elementary school systems. A slap on the hand or head. The triangular, plastic-rubber slip-on sleeves that made writing <em>as I did naturally`</em> uncomfortable.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Creatures adapt or go away to the emptiness that either is between this and that, or the emptiness after this. Really don't change a damn thing. EMPTINESS is its own challenge..</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p> My left arm curled snake-style where I wrote upside down. What' s wrong with knowing the backwardness of this world before all of y'all. I knew then that everything right was wrong. Just like in that old, old story. . .</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>My company ID says CONTRACT GO-BETWEEN which means no toothy fixin', and no paid days off because I feel yuck-yuck. If I break a footer it is a footer I will have to limp on and along while doing this go-between bullshit.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The Protection Division of the Conglomerated States of South North America won't chat it up with the whack-job journalists. They just won't anymore. And then there's me.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I am well-rewarded even though there's no company bennies. Most of that overpay goes to saucing up and softening the cops and administrative police body to provide information on what's going on or what's coming next. Mostly they give up days' old information. That type of data doesn't get me any kickbacks from the journies who hit my phones up all day long. The phones never stop binging, ringing, singing, or knocking. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I store them in my sock and sex toy drawer at night: five phones constantly buzzing against one another. It is like two vibrators at the same time struggling to give off the 10,177 buzzes that shut this world out. That moment when the pupils dilate. It is the only drug worth chasing, and when the clarity arrives: OH if the planet could have one simultaneous orgasm. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"I'd like to buy the world an orgasm in perfect harmony."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Some Go-Betweens work the company-to-public angle. You gonna slant one way or the other. Nobody ever really met another person they didn't decide how they valued that individual.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A person can be quite wrong on first impressions, but you sorted them anyway. And you sorted them again. All your life deciding whether people are dicks, cunts, or golden. There's more good on Earth than you meet, but the shitty folk really have a way of upending this equation.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>And you're no different. You get known to be what you are no matter how you try to bend the future. Boy, you is what you is. Stop fighting and go be happy. I like to lie about what the cops are doing, and I make a small living at doing so. This is better than sucking dicks for money to buy pussy. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><em>Never look backward to move forward.</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Some days I get a hooker just to have somebody to talk to at dinner. All the time they're negotiating condom on or off, blowie or butthole. Listen: let's just enjoy the glass of red and eat these mushrooms stuffed with crabmeat. <em>But what about piss-play? That's only 25 extra.</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I have a shielded boot I hide my knife and messaging watch inside when I get wrangled through courthouse security. Been doing this twenty years and same asshole cops gotta try and play tough-guy. That's their gig now. No longer harassing folk for a busted tail-light and escalating that to a resisting charge. They froth at the mouth at somebody breaking the rules &amp; protocols. Joe Everyday comes in to get a marriage license and spends ten useless minutes because the cop whose wife leaves mayonnaise out all night (and is slowly poisoning him) needs to pat him down repeatedly. Fucking cops. A buddy got three days in jail for forgetting to empty his pockets. The cop didn't like his attitude.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>These are the dumbfucks I play interpreter to journalists for. I take a multi-layered question and break it down in to 2nd grade, low word count, binary questions. That's to get them talking. It's the agreement that brings down their guard. A beer after work. Some chips from the machine that still owes the 2 bucks. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>And I gotta be part-time xenophobic, racist, and misogynistic. If they knew me they would push me down a flight of stairs. I feel that sentiment spreads to many people I know. I anger-buy the right clothes and hate-eat at the places a rube would eat. I am the loudest mime. The quietest side-show barker. The Joker's jester's assistant.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I scribe my scratchy notes on a small reporter's notebook. I bought them in bulk from an office supply store that went out of business the way all businesses eventually die. Disappeared from the Earth by Time. Sharpening the pencils had to be done by scissor-scrape, which broke pencils so I carried a dozen, a thick rubberband holding them firmly. The dipshit cops won't allow a plastic sharpener to go beyond their single checkpoint. I could kill a motherfucker with that blade.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Just to stand around and wait to catch a ADA at the snack machine, or sneaking off for a quick smoke; just to be ignored. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>An industrious GB knew the quick way was a simple bribe. Most folk can be turned in any direction with the simplest and most basic methods that give them the warm fuzzies. An easy third of my professional life was juggling gifts. I required an actual cornucopia filled with cash cards, tickets to upcoming events,</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1155</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-10-17 02:08:49]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-10-17 02:08:49]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-10-17 02:08:49]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[future-forward]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[private]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[I think you 'd better get down here, right away!]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/i-think-you-d-better-get-down-here-right-away/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 21 Oct 2022 16:17:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1168</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The first thought that pushes through the dream-wake is usually a happy one. What happens? I give annoyances space to grow into problems when they aren't even there to begin with. Why do I constantly tighten down the bolts on a machine that needs so little maintenance? Am I unsatisfied with happiness? My mean behavior would say I am. My avoidance of intimacy would say I am.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1168</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-10-21 16:17:53]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-10-21 16:17:53]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-11-29 03:34:56]]></wp:post_modified>

		<wp:status><![CDATA[private]]></wp:status>

		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="dream-journal"><![CDATA[Dream Journal]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="recovery"><![CDATA[Recovery]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1187]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Unborn]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/unborn/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 15 Apr 2023 00:43:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1386</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I've had enough. This was predictable and expected. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I should have burned every decision and chose differently. I carry only regret past the veil.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>And I am well versed in traveling light(er) than before.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><s>Goodbye.</s></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Maybe I need a vacation, and I don't mean taking my life. Just some time to re-center; to appreciate this world and the wonders to be discovered.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I am tired of being talked to, talked down to. The relentless slog, the word soup fog of my mistakes bouncing around my head both out and in. I give in, I give up. This is not retreat or surrender. I've been absorbed by a different path/plan.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Dreams gone. Passion projects abandoned. I do not enjoy this life.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
