							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Tension Rod Factor]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/tension-rod-factor/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 07 Sep 2021 21:19:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.lifebydictionary.com/wordpress/?p=863</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Love anything long enough and it breaks. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":903,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/photo_2021-02-18_06-07-19-1024x576.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-903"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The Self splinters from within if the external forces don't force your hand first. Sadness up in the wet, heavy air: listen now to the frog-song and tarp flap sonata. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I was always going to say goodbye.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Drown out the tinnitus with heels set into the pavement or earth with conviction. Just, move away from the routine that traps. Lunge into the unknown. Fail over and over.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":872,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://www.lifebydictionary.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/photo_2021-09-23_12-48-32-1024x576.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-872"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>863</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2021-09-07 21:19:28]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2021-09-07 21:19:28]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2021-09-07 21:19:28]]></wp:post_modified>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[tension-rod-factor]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="pandemic"><![CDATA[Pandemic]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[872]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[#1 prescribed solution to living]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/1-prescribed-solution-to-living/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 06 Oct 2021 10:20:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.lifebydictionary.com/wordpress/?p=882</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Disaster District shifted again last night. The western border is now the river bridge bypass. Everything uptown from there still safe. You can still use money, get fuel and foodstuffs. Here though the lights are on a non-patterned brown out schedule that's no schedule. If it's down, everything just stops. The corners go hot again with bartering and arguing over every trade. Each scam and hand-to-hand conveyance a chance to get over on the other. Ya either the mark or not. Don't get complacent. That easy life is for them back uptown. And definitely don't get fooled by nostalgia. The best days are ahead. There was never any doubt that we'd carve out some happiness from the whole cloth of darkness.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":901,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/photo_2021-03-18_07-18-06-835x1024.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-901"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>882</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2021-10-06 10:20:50]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2021-10-06 10:20:50]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2021-10-06 10:20:50]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2021-10-06 10:20:50]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[1-prescribed-solution-to-living]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[883]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[fever inducer tablets at dawn]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/fever-inducer-tablets-at-dawn/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 Dec 2021 12:25:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=921</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:image {"id":922,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/photo_2021-12-02_06-23-23-768x1024.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-922"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Fear of history.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>921</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2021-12-02 12:25:03]]></wp:post_date_gmt>

		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>

		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="dream-journal"><![CDATA[Dream Journal]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="pandemic"><![CDATA[Pandemic]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="photographs"><![CDATA[Photographs]]></category>
						</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[ledger]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/ledger/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Dec 2021 11:03:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=926</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I chased all form of chimera throughout the nights of my life. Perceived, imagined, and the wisps of smoke that twist inside grey matter after nights, days, weekends, (soon) months of substance abuse. The line between when I drifted off purposely and when actual psychosis curled its tendrils around my brain stem was long erased. A shadow of pencil lead smudged on my forehead like Ash Wednesday.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I went crazy and all I got out of it was tinnitus, poor memory, an addiction to everything I've encountered, lost loves and found ones. An endless checklist of skateboards and music cassettes. Rough lips after Mardi Gras from every girl and boy I kissed or who kissed me. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":918,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none","style":{"color":{"duotone":["#000000","#ffffff"]}}} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/photo_2021-03-07_13-39-09-1-1024x768.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-918"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It was worth it.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>926</wp:post_id>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Larghissimo]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/larghissimo/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 19 Dec 2021 21:54:14 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=928</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:image {"id":929,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/photo_2021-12-19_15-50-52-1024x1024.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-929"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The escape routes are closed. Time arrives. Here we go.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>928</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2021-12-19 21:54:14]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2021-12-19 21:54:14]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2021-12-19 21:54:14]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2021-12-19 21:54:14]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>

		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="dream-journal"><![CDATA[Dream Journal]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="pandemic"><![CDATA[Pandemic]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="photographs"><![CDATA[Photographs]]></category>
						</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Benefits Extension Request]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/benefits-extension-request/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 23 Jan 2022 03:57:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=933</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:image {"id":934,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/photo_2022-01-22_21-52-24-1024x1024.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-934"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I died and wandered on the sidewalks. They had to be here somewhere. Loneliness has to end with death. Somewhere the people I didn't connect with in life must be here. There are so many dead everywhere. Even in the end of everything there is the glut of people with their lost thoughts and plans. --Have you seen my friend Carol?</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>No. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>933</wp:post_id>

		<category domain="category" nicename="photographs"><![CDATA[Photographs]]></category>
						</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[only the broken may apply]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/only-the-broken-may-apply/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 21 Apr 2022 10:57:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=941</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph {"dropCap":true} -->
<p class="has-drop-cap">Perhaps it was a gust of wind, but I would stake my life on this: it was the Hand of the Unknown that pulled me back to the Living. Call it whatever you want, in any language. I know I was touched, and that I matter.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I am different, and will flourish and succeed. In this I give thanks, and alms. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":942,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none","style":{"color":{"duotone":["#000000","#ffffff"]}}} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/photo_2022-04-21_05-52-01-768x1024.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-942"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I wanted to get as close to the veil as possible. A breath away from passing through, a stumble down a stairwell or heart attack when nobody is around. Float out and up and away. A chimera wrapped in late April fog stretched thin from the river, across the battlefield and cemetery to my front and back door. The wrap-around of memory and forgetfulness.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The only path I wasn't afraid of was wanton self-destruction and neglect. I have lost weight and direction. I have retooled the pathways in the brain to confuse and torture myself. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I am here by the grace of LIVING, and I will not let this life be lost again.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<category domain="category" nicename="recovery"><![CDATA[Recovery]]></category>
						</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[where is the madness that you promised me]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/where-is-the-madness-that-you-promised-me/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 27 Apr 2022 23:40:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=946</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>DREAMSCAPE: Forced into hand-to-hand combat over a drunken insult that was only cast in response to a much younger man heckling my friend. The law is the law in all parts of the land. None escape* (see Escape Clause below--must have Palladium-level access to view)</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>No one is an exception* (see Exception Clause below--must have Silver-level access to view)</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The first time the jail intake door closes I was shocked at the loudness. Every time since it isn't the hollow echoed clack that shocks me. It is a worm of fear that I will never get back out. The worm eats through my guts, wraps my heart tightly, makes way to twist my tongue against me.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I have always been my own worst enemy, and I have another solid 48 years in me to go.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I'm just getting started, motherfuckers.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I remember the kisses. I remember the goodbyes. I remember the bus pulling out of the station at dawn.  </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":912,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/photo_2021-06-04_06-28-48-768x1024.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-912"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Gang of Dolphins]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/994-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 04 Jul 2022 12:16:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=994</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>There is so much joy and amazement in this life to be discovered; yet depression hides almost all of it for the entirety of a lifetime.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This ain't living right.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:gallery {"linkTo":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-gallery has-nested-images columns-default is-cropped"><!-- wp:image {"id":989,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->

<!-- /wp:gallery -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>994</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-07-04 12:16:13]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-07-04 12:16:13]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-07-04 12:16:13]]></wp:post_modified>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Apocalypse sashay]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/apocalypse-sashay/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 22 Jul 2022 15:54:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1022</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:image {"id":1023,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/photo_2022-07-22_10-52-49-1018x1024.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-1023"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I was told there would be refreshments here at the end of TRUST and HOPE.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>What's that? Some new movie or graphic novel you picked up at the library? Yeah, prolly the only place those words still have meaning. I knew a coworker named Hope. She was kind, but made decisions she'd regret. Each weekend we would sit on the rooftop of the theatre as she would tell her most recent tale, and try her hardest to make sense of why she went wild on the weekends after work. None of my business, I'd say. And it wasn't. But those decisions made these humans sad. I worry about her still, twenty years removed. Walk these paths long enough and it's all a private el camino.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Ain't never known a cat named Trust though. His enforcer prob named Humanitarian Hally. That's like Sally with an H, and you got any cash on ya?</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1022</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-07-22 15:54:42]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-07-22 15:54:42]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-07-22 15:54:42]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-07-22 15:54:42]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[apocalypse-sashay]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="novel"><![CDATA[Life by Dictionary, a novel]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="photographs"><![CDATA[Photographs]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Overnight]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/overnight/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 30 Jul 2022 12:07:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1055</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I'm left with soreness, and a fear of no future. Who would desire private counsel? The cameras swivel, the shutters clack. The omni-mics pick up every utterance of disgust. They know your thoughts before the conclusions have a chance to congeal in that noodled-gravy case on your bobbily-assed neck. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I don't like any of this, and do not like who I am.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":1060,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/photo_2022-07-31_18-59-48-1024x824.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-1060"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1055</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-07-30 12:07:19]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-07-30 12:07:19]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-07-30 12:07:19]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-07-30 12:07:19]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[overnight]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[former person]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/former-person/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 02 Aug 2022 09:41:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1068</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Loneliness in any language comes full-stop with a tiresome gaze that sees what's beyond, yet still laments for what lingers. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[clutch pedal, shift]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/clutch-pedal-shift/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 16 Aug 2022 16:24:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1077</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The slow-motion apocalypse has sped up noticeably. Make sense? Nope. IT is coming and we are not prepared. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>There are so few of us.</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1077</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-08-16 16:24:49]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-08-16 16:24:49]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-11-29 04:05:44]]></wp:post_modified>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[in the cut]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/in-the-cut/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 18 Dec 2022 13:03:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.lifebydictionary.com/wordpress/?p=869</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The first bit of paper hung up on my walls was an unfolded map of the world. Relatively current for 1980-something. The map preceded band photograph rip-outs and skateboard magazine photos. Where will I go, and what will I discover is out there in the nebulae? </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Everybody wants to leave and nobody wants to stay. It's the damned staying that matters. I am convinced I can fly even if it is not here in corporal form. I am convinced there's a dark mark on my heart that scratches and claws to salvage despair from the bosom of happiness. All these wonderful people who try and help me, and I fight it all. Let me have my moment(s) of sadness so it may pass through me, and only I will remain.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Trust me. I am keenly aware of how lucky I am to be alive. I do not take this world for granted, and chances are high that I love you. Yes, you.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1251]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Dream Night of August 4, 2022]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/dream-night-of-august-4-2022/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 20 Dec 2022 05:16:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1072</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A large group of old friends and new family gathered in a park near the Outsider Art Museum, just a few blocks from downtown. Sunny day, moderately warm. Comfortable and dry. My paternal grandmother was but a bit younger than I remember and knew her. She was affable yet full of salty rejoinders. A few of my cousins, again on my father's side, also appeared and disappeared. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This dream had no problem to solve or quest. There was no frantic escape from faceless bad guys in constant pursuit. There was no sexual tone to the dream at all. Just warmth and unending camaraderie. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We played horseshoes and someone asked about a corn-hole thing. I don't know if this was in the past, the now, or future. Ages came and went. One moment a friend was young, and the next in their 30's or 40's. I did not learn the rules of corn-hole in any decade I've passed through. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I showed them that I could fly. One wills it so. I held  a few of their hands and we flew around our gathering⁠—never higher than a cheap kite. Most wanted to try⁠—none asked how. Nobody cares about <em>the process</em> any more.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>My paternal grandmother and I talked privately. Said she was ready to date again, and more so than that, reclaim her sex life. Later she said in a circle of the women that she wanted to visit an adult XXX store to purchase a few toys. My uncle gasped with a wince. Someone I don't know or remember offered to bring her soon. I remember her smile in the dream and in my memories of visiting her. So kind to me. I wonder what dirty deeds were scattered through her past.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I feel like I'm tumbling into the abyss when I fly or float. The firmament only a few feet below yet I felt an anxious fear each time. What if I am too high, or the ground opens up to swallow me, gone for good one final last time?</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I hope I see these people in dreams again. This was the most content I've been in so very long. I am lucky to have remembered even this much of it.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I do not recall dreams/nightmares where I don't fly. My mother said my bones were filled with helium. We carry those falsehoods far into our adult life. When I am out in public and feel anxious I try to fly. Tense my shoulders and internally command myself: <em>UP!</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It will work in this lifetime. I am sure of it.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="dream-journal"><![CDATA[Dream Journal]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="pandemic"><![CDATA[Pandemic]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1208]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[a stochastic simulation of fuzzy loss]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/a-stochastic-simulation-of-fuzzy-loss/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 17 Aug 2022 01:51:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1080</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Love repeats over and over all around us; even when we have become dull instruments of broken receiving array. Greying black patch cords with unmatched connectors. The great tangle of wire and shielding on the side of the Ultra-State highway running 5,000 feet above the terrain just outside of Boulder. We saw the billboards on the Trans-Pacific caterpillar that shuttled us away from a very bad and overpriced dinner in Guam. What a bad decision to travel that far on a recommendation for pot-stickers and unregulated beer.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The caterpillar cutting under the ocean at subsonic, a free ride if you let the ad servers fatten your gear with a week's worth of persuasion. The better-off opted out with credit or cash. The poor always get fucked. A week's worth of value-added content: about to commit larceny? Here's our recommended outfit. . .</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We are on the Ultra-State and headed back to the West Coast to gather our things from the latest eviction. Leases grow shorter and shorter as prices rise. This place we managed to keep for three months. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We took turns carrying each other over the threshold. The heart chooses you in every daydream and every past, and I follow only the chimera thrashing inside my heart. They are the path. The blood-borne desire. The virus is the cure. Sweat on our bellies. Laughter when we still listened to each other.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Love repeats over and over. You were happy before me and that meant something. I have been notes of music lost without form. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1080</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-08-17 01:51:41]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-08-17 01:51:41]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-11-29 04:05:29]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-11-29 04:05:29]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>

						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Staggered Distribution of the NOW]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/staggered-distribution-of-the-now/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 23 Aug 2022 22:44:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1087</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>They are in the hell and heaven each and every day. There is no escape, and the lessons were learned long ago. We have turned our shoulders on the singular exit. <em>Death is not a strategy.</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1087</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-08-23 22:44:44]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-08-23 22:44:44]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-11-29 04:05:17]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-11-29 04:05:17]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[staggered-distribution-of-the-now]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="dream-journal"><![CDATA[Dream Journal]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="recovery"><![CDATA[Recovery]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Dream Notes 9/5-6/22]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/dream-notes-9-5-6-22/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 07 Sep 2022 04:17:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1091</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The bus stop had a hostel nearby. People shuffled in and out of the rooms and lobby or courtyard as they waited for the next bus or train that left from the large concrete building designed in an 1930's art deco fashion.station. The buses lined up on the west side, and the train tracks terminated and began on the east. The hostel's campus stretched over several lots--row homes that had been converted to house the transient who were in-between destinations, and an old office building converted to temporarily house those who could afford a semi-private room and bathroom.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The poor rooms didn't have any bunks. Floor room only. Find a spot and throw down your sleeping bag or the scratchy, small, green blanket the check-in employee provided you. Red shag carpet with thick padding covered the entire room. The floor was comfortable enough but the blanket was a horrible reminder of jail or the military. Those blankets kept you colder when it was cool and overheated when the room was warm. A goddamned modern technological wonder of opposite-engineering. Only a government could produce these blankets. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I missed a connection and had to crash for the night. I woke up and couldn't find my wallet, phone, or keys. I had left Bobby's Nissan 280z in a field that sat low off of the road. The car wouldn't handle well and I couldn't keep it straight in the lane. The side-grass caught the tire and pulled the car in. I tried to drive it out of the field but kept getting stuck in the high bushes and weed.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is not chaotic or disjointed enough. Nobody has floated away yet. There is no dissolve in this universe. One just goes up, away, and somewhere else. There were women walking around in negligees. I remember seeing high leg and hint of ass. I remember a man getting his dick sucked by a homeless guy. I stopped and glanced. He said: "You don't want any of this," and he went back to servicing this frat boy.  I would never find the car. Everything I owned was inside of it. A trash bag of t-shirts, a shoebox of cassette mixtapes. A few skateboard decks. My toolbag. Where was the car? I thought I parked it in the back. Thought I pushed it the last hundred feet near the dumpster. That heavy fucking car made of steel and little plastic. I could push/jump start it in almost any gear, anywhere. So much of ability is willpower. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Imagine not being able to find your car keys and you are up against the clock to be somewhere important. This is a life-changing opportunity and you have blown it. The simplest plan: be prepared, and you decided to throw all of everything into the trash heap of chance, and you went wild. You don't know where your wallet is. You don't know how you got back to your apartment. You woke up on the floor, stretched across the threshold in a mess of your own vomit. You pissed yourself. You smell of hot dog, pussy, sweat, bourbon. What is in your hair all glumped up? </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The hostel grand room was about half-occupied and I found a place a couple of bodies away from the rear wall. The train horns never stopped. I fretted over the car. I shouldn't have been so drunk to begin with. Maybe it wasn't here at all. Maybe that was a dream, a quick lost thought that floated in and left with just a hint of what happened.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The anxiety of no money for another night or a ticket anywhere. Where was the car? The room kept filling up. A few small families with toddlers showed up. The loudness and the whining that made the other guests audibly complain to no one. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The lobby had these old couches with raggedy plaid cushions. There were families waiting for entry and their kids were jumping on the couches. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Once I went as a chaperone for a Cub Scouts camping trip. Hot and humid Florida panhandle late summer. Bugs. We let the boys fish a bit, and then put them around a fire and told tales.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I saw the woman on the other side of the fire. Sometimes the connection does all of the lifting.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The children drifted off to sleep, tired from a hike and a bunch of running all around. My son's stepdad also chaperoned with me. We bunked in the same tent. I said my stomach was bubbling and I unzipped my way out into the woods. I knew where she'd be, smoking a few cigarettes. I had a small flask of bourbon and a soda with two foam cups and no ice. We made small talk for some minutes, and then walked off to kiss and touch each other. The dumb bodies doing the conversation.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1091</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-09-07 04:17:35]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-09-07 04:17:35]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-11-29 04:05:05]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-11-29 04:05:05]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[dream-notes-9-5-6-22]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="dream-journal"><![CDATA[Dream Journal]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Thief, Liar, Addict, WM: 130#]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/thief-liar-addict/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 15 Sep 2022 21:48:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1099</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I am tired. Not enough for suicide, but the wear and tear of life keeps on piling up. It's the now and the yesterday of it all. That nothing will change for a very long time. All I can do is go to sleep, wake up, and try again.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"color":{"background":"#dcbdbd00"}}} -->
<p class="has-background" style="background-color:#dcbdbd00">It really is not worth it though. This is how I know I have become a dullard. I am not even wise enough or brave enough to just move along to the come-what-may.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The ghosts of my indecision will haunt this world forever. That is legacy. What you did not do. Who you gave up on. When you walked away instead of doing the hard, internal work.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Today I will loathe myself more than yesterday. Never give up on giving up.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"dropCap":true} -->
<p class="has-drop-cap">I am 52 and I have reached downward to my 16 year-old weight. I'm not even abusing anything. I'm just sad, and hungry, and neglect my hunger. To waste away is to offer no resistance, and to let the Natural Path do its unending work. Let me unwind this consciousness and ego. Let slip the tendrils of desire and anger clean from my grasp.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Even love doesn't matter in the end.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[The Hunger Fraud]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/the-hunger-fraud/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 18 Sep 2022 20:36:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1107</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph {"backgroundColor":"nv-dark-bg","textColor":"nv-site-bg"} -->
<p class="has-nv-site-bg-color has-nv-dark-bg-background-color has-text-color has-background">I'm not hungry. I just complain a lot. I'm not skinny, I just whine too much. I'm not tired of 1/2 cup of oatmeal and a bland pack of ramen a day, I just like to virtue-CRY. Where are the nubbins that you promised me?</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Where is the sacrifice?<br></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"backgroundColor":"nv-dark-bg","textColor":"nv-site-bg"} -->
<p class="has-nv-site-bg-color has-nv-dark-bg-background-color has-text-color has-background">Even fun is denied. STAMPED and case closed. Go away.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[I/O used AI to choose my time of departure]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/i-o-used-ai-to-choose-my-time-of-departure/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 18 Sep 2022 23:00:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1111</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Come on with it li'l lady--ain't nobody here thinking I'm here. Don't tip them mufuckas off and go and get this all fucked up. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>JUST let the corrections to this timeline happen. Don't correct no shit won't be no shit, sang the workmen to the pay-bosses e'ery goddamned day.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>It's okay to go away. It's okay to say "hey hey, see y'all fools on the flipside. . ."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:verse -->
<pre class="wp-block-verse">I wanted my hair to grow
long, but the ambience 
was too much there

I wanted to walk in
this world without worry,
every conversation more
logistics of living, instead 
of the living

the planning of the planned
Were these turnaround years 
and not the miserable same

I give I give up I give in</pre>
<!-- /wp:verse -->]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Canticle Finale]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/canticle-finale/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 23 Sep 2022 20:58:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1120</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph {"dropCap":true} -->
<p class="has-drop-cap">Some say the art is there already, the way a sculptor lets his labor and time do the revealing. This isn't granite its a pair of hands wrapped in cloth or rope. You feel the ache and the fiber of it all. But what if one does not stop and it's now bones or sticks that could be squinted at to appear as bones. You remove too much. The essence is gone. This no boat in drydock repair and replaced to be its own self of what it was or wasn't. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is more than reconfiguration, transfiguration. Too late to gather up the hair, shavings, paint chips, laughter, nightmare and throw it all up with a !poof! and pray you find a way back, walking in offset shoes, backward, through your own trapdoors.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[All of this has happpened (again) before]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/all-of-this-has-happpened-again-before/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 06 Oct 2022 10:53:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1121</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:image {"id":1122,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/photo_2022-10-06_05-50-00-768x1024.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-1122"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Get yours while you can. The end of the world is coming. Love has lost. Get <em>RIGHT</em> with whatever you believe in, settle old scores, and spend your free time admiring the natural world. It goes away.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Everything goes away.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Lie Redaction Therapy]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/lie-redaction-therapy/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 20 Oct 2022 18:28:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1165</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Life is no disease. I asked for reentry, and to this time, these places I have traveled. The right now &amp; here. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I am going to unravel many of the lies I carry as truth. Only after this is underway will I truly be ready to tell stories.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1165</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-10-20 18:28:29]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-10-20 18:28:29]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-11-27 22:53:54]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-11-27 22:53:54]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[lie-redaction-therapy]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="dream-journal"><![CDATA[Dream Journal]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="photographs"><![CDATA[Photographs]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="the-ending"><![CDATA[The Ending]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1208]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[November 11-12, 2022  a Nightmare, of sorts]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/november-11-12-2022-a-nightmare-of-sorts/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 12 Nov 2022 10:57:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1171</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph {"dropCap":true} -->
<p class="has-drop-cap">At a meeting hall, perhaps Veterans or Kiwanis or Elks Lodge. Old building with several acoustic ceiling tiles missing from the water-pocked drop ceiling. There's an ice-chest on a plastic folding table. There's no tablecloth and my sister is distraught. She moves about the room commenting and critiquing whatever catches her gaze. Busy work, I guess. A few loiter around the table, drinking bottled beer.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>There are no chairs. I forgot them. I didn't even try and order any.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We are at my father's wake, or gathering. Whatever his religion would call this.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>His mahogany casket is polished enough to see one's clear reflection if close enough. I have yet to stand still, alone, in front of it, him.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I am aware of the dream. I hover a foot off of the linoleum and glide to the ice-chest. Only NA and light beers are bedded down between the crushed ice. He loves a cup of crushed ice. Not a soul is surprised at my floating around the hall. This is what he does, they realize. His sister? She frets. Ken? He flies and hopes for a chance to fly away. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>My sister is at David's casket. She is bawling, and in between heavy, wet sobs she gesticulates. She always becomes the star attraction. So many years gone now, I have come to love her peculiarities. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I begin her way. My legs are heavy as if I am dragging iron chains. I feel woozy the way one does after drinking too much and rising to walk, or leaving a bar stool. Once in the East Village I was telling some story half-made up, and gesticulating also. My feet wrapped inside of the stool's legs. I built up steam, rocking to and fro, and then the stool tips over backward. I land ribs first on a coffee table that was crammed up near the bar's front window nook. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Broke one rib and bruised a few other. Still didn't let that deter my night. That's a good memory. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I don't see how any funeral can be carried forward as a good memory. We drag that pain along to remind us there <em>are</em> good times to come which are in stark contrast to this dark afternoon.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The sun is out. The month is December, and the dry air is just cool enough to jacket up. I wish it were raining. I wish these people did not come while I was here. I will hear story after story about a man I mythologized. I built my personality around a handful of interactions he and I shared.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>For starters it is okay to be angry, but not at the people you love. AND you must let them know that you separate your frustrations from any judgment of them.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>When my father and I were in some crappy part of late seventies Chicago a young man tried to mug us at knife-point. Dad told him "You better fucking kill me if you plan on sticking me with that little knife!" The first time I remember remembering him curse. The first time I was party to him protecting me from an active threat. <em>All of the things a parent does selfless and tirelessly behind the scenes of a large portion of our lives.</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I cursed a LOT after that, but not in his earshot. I don't believe I uttered a curse word in his company until I was in my mid-twenties.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>After the mugger decided not to engage, he jogged off and around a corner. I was scared and wanted to hold his hand. He told me "not here, not now. Never show you are afraid in public." We got sodas from a drugstore, and he continued "fear is natural and healthy, but don't be the weak one. You must stand tall." Funny now that I reminisce as I was probably 4'9" or so.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>He wanted me to play intramural sports, so I did. With my lazy right eye I was a horrible batter on my Peanut League team. Not even a single foul ball. So Dad took me a handful of times to the batting cages. Made me stand in there, even though scared to try.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"dropCap":true,"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-drop-cap has-medium-font-size">He said <em>the entirety of this life is all about the trying</em>. He was not wrong, after all. Our last game, the team in last place, I had what would be my final at-bat. Two missed swings, and a ball. 1-2 and I said <em>fuck it</em> and swung away. Cracked a single over the 3rd baseman's glove. I was in shock and forgot to run to first. My father was there for that game, and he almost always had work or other reasons to miss most of my games.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I remember the fire in his eyes. A large toothy smile beaming through a 1970's mustache.  I had done good for the first time, I recollect now. Next batter up hit a line drive to the pitcher, and that was that for baseball.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>My brother T. was consoling J. I came up behind and bear hugged. I remember that moment in the dream because I was there when my father's older brother did the same to Dad and his sister at my grandmother's viewing. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Be there for others even when you don't think you can keep going. <em>You will gather strength from helping others more than you ever will from when you are in need from them.</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>T. walks my sister toward the door, probably to smoke cigarettes. Nobody else has approached the casket. The dream casket is on some type of lazy susan and rotates. I didn't question this. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>He looks young. They shaved his face. In this large, final wooden box he appears to be 20% smaller, as if death had shrunk him entirely. I stood several inches over him, but I always felt so humbled and lesser in his brash, humorous presence. His cheeks weren't puffed out in anger or laughter. He wasn't wearing glasses, and I found that disturbing.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I reach my hand forward, but the real tears startle me awake. I am smiling and crying quietly in my bed. My best friend sleeps next to me, her dreams full of snorts and giggles.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-11-12 10:57:29]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>

		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>

		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>

						<wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Lock Me Up in Unhappiness and Throw Away the Key]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/lock-me-up-in-unhappiness-and-throw-away-the-key/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 14 Nov 2022 17:24:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1180</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Give this time to grow before the rot sets in. <em>YOU HAVE ONLY KNOWN MEMORIES</em>. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>All the happiness and sadness is the reiteration of the last time you conjured up the thoughts in your head of whatever you believe, right now, was that happiness or sadness.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You remember the idea of a thing and not a thing.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Let the rot win. There's no hope.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":1212,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="http://www.lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/E18B6950-07D1-4AA2-B169-C840765032D7-768x1024.jpeg" alt="" class="wp-image-1212"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-11-27 22:51:49]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>

		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Dream Sequence(s) 11/22-23/2022 The Polaroid]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/dream-sequences-11-22-23-2022-the-polaroid/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 20 Dec 2022 03:28:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/?p=1184</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>The Drive</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The convertible struggled to keep the above-limit pace along the Outer-Coastal Interstate that arced along the Gulf of Mexico from Corpus Christi, Texas to Naples, Florida. The 85 MPH speed limit meant nothing 20 miles out from land on the raised highway. Four-laned on each side the crescent concrete roadway relieved traffic pressure from the decaying inland road system. Out here everyone hauled ass.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This 4-cylinder convertible barely made 85 MPH. Tractor trailers and panel vans zipped by in the far two left lanes. She looked in the rear-view constantly in fear of a sports car coming too quickly for a lane change. We stopped at each off-ramp rest station to grab snacks and check the news for any mention of our escape.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Near Tampa we hit the off-coast water conversion plants. The four-lane splits into four separated, above water concrete slim roads, the speed drastically reduced to 30 MPH. It slows again to 10 MPH. The noise of the pumps drowns the streaming music out. We guide the convertible on to hydroplane ferry that navigates the puzzle system of pipes between the conversion intakes and the conversion plants themselves. It's a back and forth and left and right of avoiding the machinery. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The hydro-ferry terminates at a large parking lot and another rest area. This stop traffic from both directions is mixed. One could turn around and go back from whence they came if they so desired. Nobody comes this far out to turn back. A decision is a decision. There are no vacationers out here. Only truckers, smugglers, and fools escaping the last mistake.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>THE HOUSE</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Brown-bricked and three stories not counting the basement. The multi-level home backed into hole sixteen of a highbrow golf course. Sue now the sole owner of this behemoth after the reading of the last will and testament. She invited us to catalog her aunt's belongings, and sort her own personal things from the hoarded piles of EVERYTHING her aunt collected. Sue took sole care of her aunt the last few years. TV Guides for years. Tupperware holding Tupperware. Bags and bags of stuffed animals separated by some system nobody had figured out yet.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Now Sue also had too many things. Art from most movements, furniture spanning hundreds of years. All of it mixed with no rhyme or reason with pet rocks, AS SEEN ON TV kitchen appliances. The Matisse in the Grand Room had a Snuggie slung over the corner. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>She photo-texted me an image of an old Polaroid. R &amp; my hand entwined. Late 1980's. My right hand on a stick shift nob, R's fingers, clasped on top of mine. The color had long faded. "Halloween" written in black magic marker on the top white border, "1988" on the bottom. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The starter was broken on the car and I had to back down any incline to start it in reverse, or get a stranger to assist me with starting it forward, popping the clutch in second gear, keeping the motor revved, and moving right along. The soft-top had dry-rotted long ago. We just endured rain, and pulled over any available overpass or tree-cover for heavy storming. Strategic parking every time. And waiting. There's no rush in a life without time.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1187]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Negative Five Seconds Rule]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/negative-five-seconds-rule/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 27 Nov 2022 22:26:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1200</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>No more cavorting with the other folk. Closed-circuit video surveillance now blankets each jogging path and biking trail along Perimeter Park. Any break in motion is justifiable cause for review. They are recording the recording equipment. Tamper-proof Future. Tampa proofing my life in reverse.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1197]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[The Heart That Care Forgot]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/the-heart-that-care-forgot/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 03 Dec 2022 19:00:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1230</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>or: Sadness as a Service &amp; Not a Bug</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I can not unwind the spinning top. Each gyroscopic motion in play. Think about your life: the day's circular rhythm, the calendar as long game, this privatized planet spinning around the sun and the sun circling the galaxy's center.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The heart does not wind up after depletion. It is not a child's plaything even though most people treat it as such. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We do not know what is beyond the singularity. Like love of all things there is only the guessing and the hope.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This is why despair always wins. We do not know.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:heading -->
<h2>AND I AM NOT DEPRESSED. I AM DISAPPOINTED IN MYSELF.</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1230</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-12-03 19:00:37]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-12-03 19:00:37]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-12-04 18:17:53]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-12-04 18:17:53]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[the-heart-that-care-forgot]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="dream-journal"><![CDATA[Dream Journal]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="photographs"><![CDATA[Photographs]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="the-ending"><![CDATA[The Ending]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1231]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[We Can Do Hard Things]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/we-cant-do-hard-things/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 06 Dec 2022 21:04:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1238</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Because somebody is always fast to the give-up. I hear nothing under or over the tinnitus. There's no goddamned metaphor to let you know.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I keep the company of those I trust, and they keep me. Null set. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Must give up social media. It poisons me with ideas that others don't care. That's not it at all. The opposite of consequence. What texture reminds you of indifference?</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>There will be no announcement. This too, disappears. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1238</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-12-06 21:04:22]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-12-06 21:04:22]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-12-11 22:11:12]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-12-11 22:11:12]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[we-cant-do-hard-things]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>

		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="pandemic"><![CDATA[Pandemic]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="recovery"><![CDATA[Recovery]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="the-ending"><![CDATA[The Ending]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1239]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[I've Turned My Back On Myself]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/ive-turned-my-back-on-myself/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 17 Dec 2022 16:40:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1244</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>What does one do when the man that he is is NOT the man he wanted to be?</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>When sadness is weaponized against you? You can not win, Ken.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Just let go.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1244</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-12-17 16:40:17]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-12-17 16:40:17]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-12-17 16:59:09]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-12-17 16:59:09]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[ive-turned-my-back-on-myself]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>

		<category domain="category" nicename="the-ending"><![CDATA[The Ending]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1249]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:comment>
			<wp:comment_id>2</wp:comment_id>
			<wp:comment_author><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></wp:comment_author>
			<wp:comment_author_email><![CDATA[ken@quantifier.org]]></wp:comment_author_email>
			<wp:comment_author_url>http://www.lifebydictionary.com</wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP><![CDATA[24.252.102.96]]></wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date><![CDATA[2022-12-17 22:04:57]]></wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-12-17 22:04:57]]></wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[This spoonful of depression scooped right out of the blackest star just refuses to be ignored. I had to let it in and get comfortable with it. But companionship is not enough for depression. Every day is more difficult. I accidentally smiled the other day at a joke, and I felt guilty. 

What poison this is with its single-use antidote that arrives too far away in the future from the damage that's done in the now.]]></wp:comment_content>
			<wp:comment_approved><![CDATA[1]]></wp:comment_approved>
			<wp:comment_type><![CDATA[comment]]></wp:comment_type>
			<wp:comment_parent>0</wp:comment_parent>
			<wp:comment_user_id>1</wp:comment_user_id>
							</wp:comment>
					</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Transit]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/a-poem-for-roblynn/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 21 Dec 2022 03:24:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1258</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:verse -->
<pre class="wp-block-verse"><strong>Transit</strong>

Late year rains relax and we wander
between the bright-bake humidity

—that reflection in the puddle isn't you
You are moonset and star turn—each ripple

asks we the nonesuch should gather any loose
receipts, parking tickets and never-phoned

numbers and send them into every
swirl of October the Ninth each season;

let it go; an evening sun glows inside you
still, in any dark night, and across the crowd

I just take all that you are, in —the only
feather of hope. The best good one.

A beginning that closes the endings.
</pre>
<!-- /wp:verse -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1258</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-12-21 03:24:42]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-12-21 03:24:42]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2022-12-29 11:58:27]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2022-12-29 11:58:27]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[a-poem-for-roblynn]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="poetry"><![CDATA[Poetry]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Ocular Sinister]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/ocular-sinister/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 27 Dec 2022 23:11:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1267</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>لست متأكدًا من أنني أريد البقاء في علاقتنا.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>This life has become a dark reflection of summer after school. The long days and lack of friends. Just an overabundance of nothingness broken up by scattered and fragmented television. My reading list dwindled from lack of interest, and I just began coasting through life with no sadness or joy. Impotence of spirit.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><em><strong>Here I am again.</strong></em> Loveless(ed) and sad--the only change to my routine is choosing which chores to do in what order. Walk the dog. Fold the clothes. Wash dishes. Clean the bathrooms. Walk the dog. Repeat ad infinitum. I don't remember tenderness or laughter. I am brittle to the touch and mean-spirited in any response. I hate myself.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I hate myself.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>So much more of the <em>World</em> for me to experience. I may be struggling with heavy depression and ideation of quitting this all, but no way in HELL will I let myself confuse entrapment, imprisonment, and morass of spirit and body. I am my biggest chain and shackle. No one else. I am the enemy. I am that which must be conquered, again.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>And again. And again.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Custom Styles]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/wp-global-styles-neve/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 10 Jul 2022 12:10:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://lifebydictionary.com/wp-global-styles-neve/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[{"version": 2, "isGlobalStylesUserThemeJSON": true }]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1003</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2022-07-10 12:10:25]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2022-07-10 12:10:25]]></wp:post_date_gmt>

		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[wp_global_styles]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="wp_theme" nicename="neve"><![CDATA[neve]]></category>
						</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[bivouac]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/bivouac/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Feb 2023 11:07:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1262</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Christopher tried again to spin a soggy cardboard drink coaster on the baby-shit green laminate bar.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"You're barely trying and you're not even drunk yet. Why even bother?" Lew asked after a short, deep burp.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Yes I am."  Chris flicked the same coaster and it flopped over the edge into something wet. "Minimally, but trying." He pulled another coaster from the stack near the tiny straws and napkins. "You still think this is about laziness." He raised two fingers in the bartender's direction. "Not even close. This, this I know–it's  about the least amount of effort in <em>any</em> attempt at a task--any task. That's the point. My method isn't lazy, and listen, real talk, it takes a hell of a lot of non-effort to be so damn sub-par." Finished his warm beer. "If you'd start to stop trying, you'll see the light."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Lew pushed his lunch plate back, adding another scratch to the bar-top and grabbed the fresh beer from the bartender's tattooed hand. He wondered what the finger tats read or meant. Only saw S, L, and finally T on the pinky. The left ring finger was messy with lines this way and that, and he moved too quickly for Lew get a good look without being creepy. <em>Big fucking hands though.</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1262</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2023-02-14 11:07:08]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2023-02-14 11:07:08]]></wp:post_date_gmt>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Lie Detection by Divination]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/lie-detection-by-divination/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 31 Dec 2022 22:58:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1278</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>AUTOFICT through slight perversion of fact.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"backgroundColor":"nv-c-1"} -->
<p class="has-nv-c-1-background-color has-background">COMING SOON</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

		<title><![CDATA[Gut bag]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/gut-bag/</link>

<p>My mid-fifties approach. I yearn for the company of people I barely remember.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[laissez les bon temps rouler]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/laissez-les-bon-temps-rouler/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 08 Jan 2023 12:38:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1290</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You won’t be with family or your lover when the end of the world comes.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You’ll be stuck in a line at the grocery, or returning a pair of shoes bought online late one night after 3/4 a bottle of wine.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>You’ll be alone, and then you’ll be nothing with the rest of us.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Let the good times roll.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>

		<title><![CDATA[wars of our inner world]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/wars-of-our-inner-world/</link>

<p>There's no black celebration for this moment:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1294</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2023-01-09 17:12:22]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
