		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Forget Everything You Know About Yourself, cried the cliché cowboys!]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/forget-everything-you-know-about-yourself-cried-the-cliche-cowboys/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 19 Jan 2023 11:59:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1298</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The un-secret police wore dull gray on this October foggy night. A balding undercover already on the public bus seated a couple of rows behind. Let-it-go released puff of air-brakes. My left headphone fell off as the driver jerked to a complete stop. Another thing lost.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The driver's command voice garbled over the intercom, "Sorry y'all but that bridge ahead is closed 'cause of this weather. I can't see ahead." He paused and throated out a few wet coughs, continued "Transfer station is two blocks ahead, other side of the bridge. walk from here." The door opened and the cabin lights illuminated to full. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Everyone shuffled to grab their bags and carry-ons: each face too bright and seen. The high resolution of real life where faces aren't behind the dream veil or software touch-ups. The split lips and exczema. A pale teenage boy grabbed his neck to hide a large hickey. His friends laughed and told him not to hide it. Life is there whether we mask it or not.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We shuffled off over the bridge. Buses were parked waiting for the fog to clear, and we waited impatiently to board. Just get home is all everyone wanted. A few to get to work. Maybe a couple of drunks transiting from bar to bar. The fog wasn't even shut-it-all-down bad. Something else was the reason for the interruption.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>A busker was collecting in an old Mardi Gras cup. My eastbound-bus line started to board and I took a place in the haphazard line. Searched each pocket for the other headphone. Gone also.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Grabbed me from behind, rushed to the concrete. Same asshole from before but with a baseball cap on. They aren't the brilliant ones. The gray secret police surrounded and formed a semi-circle, all talking at once.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Here is your judgment and punishment, dirtbag!"</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Yeah take your medicine, you goddamn' loser!" Another chirped. Kicks all around. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Take his shoes and his sense of self-worth. I got his wallet. Probably got drug shake if not half a bag." That assailant, or arresting officer's voice, was effeminate and familiar. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><em>This bum ain't got no money. Doesn't even care about himself. Blind him. Pour acid in his ears. Crack his ribs the way he likes 'em.</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1298</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2023-01-19 11:59:45]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2023-01-19 11:59:45]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2023-01-19 11:59:46]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2023-01-19 11:59:46]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[forget-everything-you-know-about-yourself-cried-the-cliche-cowboys]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="dream-journal"><![CDATA[Dream Journal]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="stories"><![CDATA[Stories]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1305]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[I care anymore]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/i-dont-care-anymore/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 19 Jan 2023 17:17:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1307</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The dream-child is mine for such a parted-second, and then it is my brother's and I'm in charge of his pasty, ginger, plump toddler, and then this Jr. and I are at some theme park with my brother and his existing family of son, daughter, wife. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Jr. and I share some cotton candy. The wisps melt-disappearing in our mouths. Sugary smiles and sticky noses. I should apply some sunscreen to him. This heat is brutal for anybody, and he's so pale. The blood seems closer to his washed-white skin. Splotches fight with scrapes and a toddler's rough and tumble manner. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We see TC on the other side of the water flume ride and wave. I wave. Jr. stares at a young girl being led on a leash by her mother. Jr. points and tilts the head the same way my dog does. We desire understanding.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I'm allowed to bring Jr. on a octopus-armed ride even though he's under the height requirement. "<em>On your lap, sir, on the lap!"</em> Soon as the ride starts I slide him to my right into the empty seat, and unbuckle and fasten the belt around his waist.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Hang on and let it be scary!" My words meet his tearing eyes. I grab his hand and pull him secured to me. The ride picks up the pace. Our stomachs are coming and going. He's afraid. "Grit your teeth and grab my hand tightly. Look at me!" I implore him.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The first set of fast drops and rises and his tension remains steady. No crying. He's got this. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Dreams let everything go wrong. I am now back in line and watching Jr. with my brother on the ride, and Jr. is laughing and in full escapist rapture. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>There are three college ladies behind me. The redhead points at Jr. and makes some comment out of my earshot. That's my ignition point.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"He's with me." A sarcastic version of smiling. Her eyes signal she heard me. "Or that's my nephew, I mean."</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>"Oh how cute! That's his dad? He's a hottie," she says in a flat and unimpressed cadence.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The first defense: always be unimpressed, and I only know to return the same. "Y'all look bored. Been here long?" I drop the park map on accident. Her friend picks it up, hands it to me, and smiles. Okay, a planned accident. Life is a series of planned accidents and apologies.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong><em>Dreamshift</em></strong>: I'm on the Gravitron and the reddish-brunette friend is pressed against me while the ride forces us back. I've rolled to my side and my hand is against her hip. The jeans feel well-washed. She has a fleck of light in her dark eyes. A smile. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The ride ends and she and I stay on while her friends stumble off to regain their composure. We are spinning away from this Earth. This is like dancing when all of the other bodies have disappeared, the lights pulse in sequence only for you. The pattern and rhythm of the song is yours alone. Yours and the person you dance with. The single moment of NOW when all the water bills and broken promises no longer exist. There is the dance of what is right now. That describes your entire past and their entire future. Right there, close enough to sweat against each other. The kiss that lets mouths meet. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>What's better is just after the kiss: that locked-in eye-to-eye tractor beam that says in plain language: we are together now, and connected.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I dunno. Maybe it is just me. Maybe I find manufactured meaning in dancing with strangers who become friends, or find hidden desire while dancing with friends. I am multitudes. I am now. <em><strong>DREAMSHIFT</strong></em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I can not find my nephew who may be my son. The park fills up with bodies. I can't remember his name. The employees keep asking questions. I feel as if I'm scrutinized. I know my brother will arrive any moment with worry.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>He was right here, sweaty and complaining about a headache. He took his tiny shirt off and put it on his head. I turned my head to find the three college girls and Jr. was gone. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>What do I miss in my past? Who do I wish was still here? I know and won't say. I don't know and say too much.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I let selfishness ruin most of thirty years of living. Thinking it would all equal out in the end. It does not. The only thing that carries weight is the love you give others, and that has no tincture of lust or desire. Just be good.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1307</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2023-01-19 17:17:36]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2023-01-19 17:17:36]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2023-01-22 01:53:25]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2023-01-22 01:53:25]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[i-dont-care-anymore]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="stories"><![CDATA[Stories]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="the-ending"><![CDATA[The Ending]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1202]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[You may qualify for reincarnation avoidance]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/you-may-qualify-for-reincarnation-avoidance/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 07 Feb 2023 14:01:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1326</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I see nothing positive in any future. Might as well mine the depths of depression and see how far down I can fall. . .</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>That was true for the briefest sliver of a moment. It does not hold and does not define me. So exactly <em>when &amp; where</em> does definition of self begin?</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Must be in every transit. The vacillated head turn that checks for oncoming traffic with worry. Back and forth and again. It was never the good of you that etched your character and it will never be the sour moments you choose to forget, either. It is the boredom of the in-between and what you do with <strong>that </strong>portion of time.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We are in the middle and alive. Enjoy the ride. It ends too soon no matter how many years you survive.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2023-02-14 11:01:57]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2023-02-14 11:01:57]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[you-may-qualify-for-reincarnation-avoidance]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="the-ending"><![CDATA[The Ending]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1325]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[The pulchritudinous of a tomorrow that never comes]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/the-pulchritudinous-of-a-tomorrow-that-never-comes/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 25 Sep 2023 17:44:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1343</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Being sad all of the time is exhausting. I’m done. This morning traffic is loud. They repaved a few road dips &amp; depressions on our street so the vroom-vroom cars can speed by, unclutched and hauling their heavy metal occupants off to their time clocks here in Cancer Alley. <em>I wonder what Suzanne made me for lunch today?</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:separator -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I wanted familiarity. I chose New Orleans in its broken-down post-glory condition to ride the rest of my life out. I had and don't desire any success in business or love. I just want to slow it all down, and find a small notch in the gearing to let this living experiment run its course.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>^^^ Maybe a year ago? Still same sadness.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[What's your refund policy on manufactured happiness?]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/whats-your-refund-policy-on-manufactured-happiness/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 Mar 2023 11:38:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1350</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:image {"id":1351,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="http://www.lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/photo_2023-03-02_05-35-19-1024x768.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-1351"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>There was a wild man lost in the Orleans Parish jail/prison system. I know because I saw him. He did not talk. He smelled like a burnt sewer, his hair long and wild and matted. The jailers didn't know his name, and couldn't identify him by fingerprint. He would not talk. They moved him from bay to cut to different bay, waiting him out.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I wonder if he died in that hell.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1350</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2023-03-02 11:38:57]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2023-03-02 11:38:57]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2023-03-08 01:23:46]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2023-03-08 01:23:46]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[whats-your-refund-policy-on-manufactured-happiness]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<category domain="category" nicename="recovery"><![CDATA[Recovery]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1359]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Beelzebub's Bathtub]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/beelzebubs-bathtub/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 04 Mar 2023 11:52:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1356</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:image {"id":1357,"sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img src="http://www.lifebydictionary.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/photo_2023-03-04_05-51-05-1024x770.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-1357"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>4 March 2023: 6:13AM CST, Arabi, Louisiana. My back porch, looking east at the sunrise. Coffee black and a crisp, cool late winter morning. The roosters are signaling another fifteen minutes have elapsed. They are not keepers of real time, or the pretense of time in any way. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I have given up yet again. That may be my singular constant in this life. The art of rebooting myself in one way or another. Today I have a mustache. Tomorrow? I don't know. I give thanks for the promise of tomorrow each morning in my own way. Prayers for the multiverse. Prayers for this moment. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Let today not be an argument. May I wrap myself up in the cloak of loneliness and find warmth. May I not get shackled by nostalgia, or trapped in the labyrinth of memory. Today is today, and that is a gift. Today is my gift to myself.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>3/18/2023 -- </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1357]]></wp:meta_value>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Walking naked & backward from Damascus]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/walking-naked-backward-from-damascus/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 28 Mar 2023 22:41:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1377</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I feel myself giving up. I am watching, detached, <em>a ghost's ghost,</em> myself through a fun mirror that brings no joy. Every action is partially delayed or obscured. There's less and less to see or hear or remember.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>That's the trick: personality removal one sliced aspect or trait at a time. Eventually there's only a bland core, and that makes the final deletion much easier. Human nature abhors boredom.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><em><strong>The first cut was the last cut.</strong></em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="the-ending"><![CDATA[The Ending]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1196]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Your Self Destruction Warranty is About to Expire]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/your-self-destruction-warranty-is-about-to-expire/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 19 Jun 2023 18:39:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1398</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><em>It is not paranoia to think everyone else is incompetent.</em> Pizza-Drugs kicked a soft pack of cigarettes off of the sidewalk and into a puddle, scintilla of light across its oily sheen. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><em>Some anem?</em>  Pulled the curtains in the one room living room/front room tight so he wouldn't think I was home. I had to pinch the flapping curtains to the wall with books at the floor. Check and check and recheck the traffic or pedestrian Pizza-Drugs type of noise. Double back and fix the books acting as anchor. Back and forth and forward again. Pizza-Drugs was lurking the block.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Let me tell ya about Pizza-Drugs. The summer midge flies, termites, and love bugs are everywhere. The streetlights yellowish glare is obscured with the living halo of short-term life. Wings and guts is all this universe ever was. He is too. I give in and answer the door. We cut bait from my studio apartment and make way across the blacktop highway into a small motorcycle bar made of concrete blocks. No fancy woodwork or copper bar-top, just beer from a cooler and a few well bottles of liquor.  </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1398</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2023-06-19 18:39:37]]></wp:post_date>

		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2023-07-23 12:10:38]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[your-self-destruction-warranty-is-about-to-expire]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Intolerance as Teacher]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/intolerance-as-teacher/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 22 Jun 2023 03:32:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1404</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I did not recognize my face in the mirror. This was not some flashback or current psychedelic trip: it was years of substance abuse, and finally I saw the monster I had become. Others saw this far before I did, but course correction took <em>me</em> not seeing <strong>me</strong> to happen for the oars to begin paddling for different shores.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>No chrysalis or sudden awareness. Just the totality of years letting myself down.It is the heaviest weight I will cast overboard.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I believe in me.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1404</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2023-06-22 03:32:53]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2023-06-22 03:32:53]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2023-06-22 10:27:25]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2023-06-22 10:27:25]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[intolerance-as-teacher]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="dream-journal"><![CDATA[Dream Journal]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="the-ending"><![CDATA[The Ending]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1333]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[The warthog who chose to sing and the mockingbird who couldn't]]></title>
		<link>http://www.lifebydictionary.com/index.php/the-warthog-who-chose-to-sing-and-the-mockingbird-who-couldnt/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 21 Jul 2023 10:18:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kenneth]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.lifebydictionary.com/?p=1409</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>I have broken the pattern. Ten years was a long midlife crisis, and here I am on the other side of it. Many friends now dead from overdose or neglect. Marriages dissolved. Sugar never survives the storms.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Build it new. Build it with trust and forgiveness. Let the body relearn what compassion is by giving it to others first. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Selfishness is a thief. Do not confuse it with self-preservation, and damn my man do NOT let addiction get the upper hand. It will rewire you again. VROOM VROOM. The salad days are finally here. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Now go love on your people. They may not forgive you, but you sure as hell can sing your song of contrition. Only the winds may hear us on the open road.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
